## Interval.isAfter() method

Returns true iff this interval's LHS &gt; `x`<!-- -->, taking into account openness. If `x` is an interval, then checks this interval's LHS is greater than RHS of `x` (again with openness).

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
isAfter(x: number | Readonly<Interval>): boolean;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  x | <code>number &#124; Readonly&lt;Interval&gt;</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`boolean`
